title: Forest fire spreads across northern Balochistan’s mountains - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
QUETTA: A massive fire, which erupted on Monday evening in the mountainous forests of Qila Saifullah district in northern Baloc­histan, was rapidly spreading across a large area despite efforts by local authorities to contain it, officials said.

“The fire, which suddenly broke out in the Spin Ghar forests, is spread over an area of around two kilometres,” said Deputy Commissioner Saeed Khan Dummor. “Hundreds of trees and bushes have been gutted by the blaze.”

The officers of Levies force responded swiftly after receiving rep­orts of the fire and began firefighting efforts. How­ever, strong winds in the area caused the flames to spread quickly, engulfing large swathes of forest land.

Additional teams dispatched by the Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA), equi­pped with fireballs and other firefighting gear, have joined the operation. Despite their efforts, the fire continues to rage across the rugged terrain.

“A dam located about 15 kilometres from the affe­cted area could serve as a water source for aerial firefighting,” Mr Dummor said. He added that the PDMA has initiated procedures to provide air support, including firefighting aircraft or helicopters, following a request from the district administration.

“We are making every possible effort to contain the fire, which has already destroyed significant natural resources,” Mr Dum­mor said. “Personnel from the PDMA, Levies, and local communities are acti­v­ely participating in the firefighting operations.”

Published in Dawn, May 20th, 2025
